result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (3rd) [Modifiers: Repeater]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (3rd) [Modifiers: Repeater] was dismissed by the court.

  • Paris Lamar Myhand was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Paris Lamar Myhand was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Paris Lamar Myhand was found guilty of Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install (2+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs of the action plus $250.00 DNA surchrge - work out payment with the agent.
Provide DNA sample.  Successfully complete AODA treatment and follow through when released.  Maintain stable employment.

Not allowed to vote or sit on jury until civil rights are restored.   May not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.  No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs.  No entrance into a facility where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
